inn1.comm: down the leg-side, flicks off the pad, and Niall O'Brien fields that with his throat after a nasty bounce! Ouch.
a measured start from Kieswetter. There's time to gauge the conditions
on the pads, and flicked urgently through midwicket. A quick call and a misfield lead to an easy single
big stride forward, solidly behind the line of the ball. Defended back down the track
squared up a touch as the ball flicks off a leading edge, but safely to short cover
leg-sided again, and three comfortable singles to wrap up the over
in the channel outside off, left well alone
sharp scamper as the ball jags down into the crease, Kieswetter reacted quickly, and made it home as the bails were flicked off
outside off, no stroke offered
defended into the leg-side
punched out to cover, tight stuff
pitched up, driven airily, Mooney leaps across the crease to snaffle in one hand, but it's a bump-ball, to the crowd's disappointment
Rankin is still feeding the pads a touch too much, and Trott will pick those off for the rest of his career. Nothing more than a nurdle off the hip
big stride forward and blocked down the track
banged in a touch shorter and quicker, and well left. A good line
nudged out to point
good wicket-to-wicket delivery, but a hint of inside-edge stifles the lbw appeal
worked off the pads, but can't find the gap
a hint of width to work with, and cut airily down to third man
right on the spot, outside off, defended
jabbed out to point
opens the face, and steers another single down to third man. It's slow-going out there
fizzes off the seam, and past the off stump as no stroke is offered
drawn fully forward, and defended to cover. Another fine over
good lift outside off, and Kieswetter acknowledges as much
climbing onto the hip, and flicked to midwicket
fuller this time, but once again speared onto the pads. More runs on the leg side
better line and length, nothing doing there
makes some room but can't drill this through the off side
fuller and defended to mid-on. Tight work from Ireland
forward, and defended with an open face to point
effort ball! That one really climbed! Tight line, angling in, and Kieswetter did well to drop his wrists and let that one fizz by
on the toes, and clipped to midwicket
another fine delivery, in the channel, demanding respect, and keeping a touch lower than the last one. No contact, and Kieswetter looks frustrated
solidly blocked to cover. No way through
dabbed down to third man, but slip pounces before it can get through
pushed out to point
whipped off the toes, but straight to square leg
lifting delivery outside off, Trott gets on top of the bounce and dabs another single to third man
and out of nowhere, Kieswetter belts a six! Not quite as he'd have planned it though. He moved early, the bowler followed him, and a cramped pull zipped off the edge and over the keeper's head!
and after that excitement, a single to rotate the strike
banged in short, Trott rides the bounce
on the toes, clipped firmly through square leg. A few boundaries starting to flow now
blocked firmly back down the track
blocked out to gully, tight line once again

cracking ball, and that's the breakthrough! It's been coming for Mooney, who has plugged away on a good length, and that one did just enough. Kieswetter committed, the ball seamed, and O'Brien did the rest. A quick pause to check the no-ball, but all clear
solidly behind his first delivery, an attempted yorker
another yorker, well dug out.
defended with soft hands into the slips
fizzed down the leg side, the first wide of the day
jabbed down into the crease, and the ball pops up to strike Trott's grille. Surprise, but no damage
defended into the slips again
blocked out to cover
something different from Trott, a skip down the pitch and a bona fide air shot
you can't bowl there to Jonathan Trott! Another trademark midwicket flick. Few batsmen in the world put those away so comfortably
defended with a hurry, that was a quicker delivery
tip-and-run to get Taylor off the mark. A fine swoop and shy from cover, but Trott is just home
attempted pull, but he was through the shot before the ball got there. Trott delivers his verdict through the stump mic
defended into the leg side
great shot from Trott, a whip through midwicket from outside off, as opposed to his bread-and-butter flick. Lots of bottom hand, and placed it well
steered to midwicket to complete the first Powerplay. Not the most powerful of all time ...
Taylor is a busy sort at the crease. Might just be because he's stump high. Prodded to leg
left all alone outside off stump. Rankin finding good pace on a slow deck
good line from Rankin. He's every bit as massive as Taylor is tiny
all over for Taylor! His much-anticipated first international innings ends with a top-edge pull that looped to midwicket. Good bouncer from Rankin and sound reward for a good morning's work
Rankin finds a good line to Trott who gets behind it to block to leg and scamper one
Morgan gets a sighter first ball. Rankin finding good bounce from back of a length
ooh, almost strikes first ball. Skids a medium-pace delivery outside off and Trott got an under-edge which reached Niall O'Brien on the half-volley
good delivery here, angling in from wide of the crease, hint of seam movement too. Inside edge squirts down to fine leg
Morgan gets another sighter, judging a good leave outside his off stump. Sort of area that he has nibbled at often
yeesh, Morgan's knee-flex has reached comedy levels. He gets down to a Taylor height before coming back up to defend
Morgan dinks a quick single to mid-on. If big KOB's throw had hit though he would have been in trouble
Trott tries to pinch a single by pushing straight to cover. Morgan rightly sends him back
Kevin O'Brien's first ball is greeted by Morgan haring down the pitch at him. He slides it down leg to counter but is wided
steady from O'Brien after the break, angling in back of a length
for the second time in three balls Morgan races up the wicket to O'Brien. Beaten outside off stump though
Morgan this time stays put and tries to slash a drive. Lack of pace off the pitch perhaps means he can only inside edge
solid defence this time back to the bowler
driven carefully into the covers, which means Ireland have started as well as they were before the break
good over from O'Brien. Morgan wanted to dart but couldn't get anything away
Cusack begins accurately and is pushed to cover for a quick single
on no! Dockrell has been watching India's fielding! He's had a shocker at third man, sliding, slipping and spilling a take after Morgan cut firmly
driven carefully down the ground
left all alone outside off stump
fuller from the bowler and Trott walked across his stumps to work it to leg, but missed
the crowd get very excited by Trott bump-balling this back to the bowler
nicely done by Morgan. Plants a front foot down, swings cleanly through the line and collects four
a long on went back after that stroke so Morgan unfurled a bit of magic. That extra cover drive of his. Timed it so well on a pitch where all others have struggled
after the pair of boundaries comes solid defence
again Morgan defends very carefully
Morgan pushed this back, past a diving bowler but couldn't get a single as midwicket scooted round
clipped down to deep square. Niall O'Brien's hustling of the fielders helped keep it to a single
with a whip of his wrists Morgan pings this from off stump past midwicket. He looks in fine fettle
smart fielding at long-off keeps this well-timed drive to one
Trott defends off the back foot. He hasn't got the fluency of Morgan but he is coming back from injury remember
Trott tries to steer this wide of short third man but instead picks out the man
good work from Ireland. Joining the dots against Trott
good work from Ireland. Joining the dots against Trott
O'Brien manages to slide one past the edge of Morgan's bat. Niall O'Brien is very swift to get the bails off
clipped to midwicket calmly. Morgan's face never ever changes expression. Except at the moment of contact with the ball, when he bares his teeth furiously
nicely done by Trott, opening the face to work a single
mid-off is up and Morgan backed himself to clear it. Again just swung his bat cleanly through a full-length ball and is flew to the boundary. Pitch looks a belter when he's batting
slid down the leg side, too far. Niall did well to get a glove in the way
worked down to third man
Morgan this time clips down to third man and will keep the strike
worked off the pads to a wide long-on
"good Alex" says Niall O'Brien. I suppose it was
back of a length and a touch leg side. Trott loves working it off his legs. That sounds like innuendo, it's not. I think
ooh Morgan didn't know all that much about this. Tried to work it to third man and it ended up a fine leg. Inside edge
enough width for Trott to slug at, not really timing well but clearing the infield to get a boundary to cover
worked quietly to midwicket. Trott picked out the man, much to his frustration
touch of spin to begin with, but from too wide of off stump and Morgan cuts a single
eesh, he's bowling like Bhaji, this is horribly short and clumped to midwicket
very very short again, Morgan tried to smash the life out of it but picked out midwicket
fuller ball, better ball but Morgan works it into the leg side for one
ah that's the Dockrell I'm madly in love with. Around the wicket, flight, loop and some turn from a perfect line. Trott blocks
invention from Trott! Off the arm in the end but reverse-sweep beats Niall O'Brien and runs away for four. Not the best opening over from the boy wonder
late dab from Morgan runs this to third man
Trott working singles more fluently now as he finds one to mid-on
good work at short cover from John Mooney. Sliding well to cut off a single. And looking like he could beat up any player on either team
defended carefully and quietly back to the bowler
Morgan times his forward block very well to mid-on
outside edge earns Morgan four. Cusack looks disgusted, as well he might
definite grip and spin for Dockrell, but Trott spots the length early and whips him square for a single
shovelled down to long-on with plenty of bottom hand for a single
tossed up beautifully by Dockrell, Trott stepping to the pitch and pushing back to the bowler
attempted sweep from Trott, but the ball dips past bat as it loops down the leg side and he wears one on the pad
very full indeed and Trott jabs down on it at the last moment to squeeze a single through gully
Morgan plays with the spin to ease the ball down to long-on for one

is that an edge? Jones came round the wicket and seamed one sharply away off the pitch past Morgan's bat ... O'Brien can't take it cleanly, however, and on second look there doesn't seem to have been anything on it
Morgan comes forward, punching to cover
again Morgan sticks his left leg down the pitch to drive, this time he's picked the gap
a little too wide of off, and Trott chops one down to third man
cracked away square of the wicket, just the single
full and quite wide, Trott leaning into a forward press and picking up a single as the cover sweeper runs in
well, Trott really might have made more of this. Short, wide, and sitting up off this slow pitch. He cuts, but picks out the fielder behind square to perfection, so just the single
Morgan is doing a good job of milking Dockrell, again just easing him to leg for a single
tossed right up to the bat, Trott driving hard back at the bowler

what a ball! Dockrell completely squares Trott up with one that landed outside the line of leg and ripped right across him. A wry smile and a nod from the batsman, who acknowledges the quality of the ball
full once again, this time Trott gets bat on the drive through mid-off
premeditated paddle sweep from Morgan, who takes the ball on the full toss and sends it bouncing down to fine leg
Jones offers up some width and Morgan cuts, but straight to backward point
much better from the bowler, who zones in on off stump to draw a defensive stroke from the left-hander
nicely straight once more. Morgan flicks to leg, but straight to midwicket
nicely played, Morgan waiting until the very last possible moment and then flicking his wrists at the ball to get it down to third man
much too short from Jones at this gentle pace, Trott rocking back to pull into the deep
Morgan ends up splayed on one knee as he attempts to scythe this through point, but he's beaten my movement off the surface to end another steady over from Jones
Trott gets right back in his crease and rides a hint of extra bounce, chopping to short third man for one
this isn't the biggest ground in the world, and Morgan has just heaved Dockrell right out of it. Dockrell flighted one up in the slot outside off, and Morgan sent it sailing away with a slog sweep
tapped into space on the leg side for a quick single
there's some interest from the bowler as Trott is beaten in the flight and struck on the pad, but this was definitely drifting down leg
bat on it this time, Trott tapping it defensively to off
driven through the covers once more, this time he finds the gap
cracked down the ground by Trott, an easy single taken
Morgan ends up in an almost identical position as he did in Jones' last over, getting down on one knee and aiming a fierce swipe towards point ... but getting nothing on it
straighter from Jones, Morgan leans into a solid defence
there's his fifty! Morgan sliced late at this one to get it very fine towards third man. It was too close to the cut, but he got just enough bat on it to pick up the four

ouch! Now who has this hit? It was pitched right up and Morgan smacked it straight back down in the pitch in the air. It appears the bowler palmed it away and the ball went on to strike the umpire on the back. No harm done, fortunately
a touch too short from Jones, and the ball sits up nicely to be pulled out to deep square leg
clipped into space, Trott playing with the spin, and a quick single is the result
where Trott plays with the spin, Morgan nudges against it as Stirling comes round the wicket, the single coming at midwicket
Trott is right back on his stumps again, waiting for the ball to spin and then placing it into the leg side
beaten by the spin outside off! To his credit, Morgan played the line and didn't push out at it. Appreciable help off the surface for Stirling
tossed right up, Morgan flicks off the toes for one
too short, too wide, and Stirling is fortunate this isn't four. Trott cuts, but the fielder is able to get around in time to cut it off
and immediately Morgan uses his feet, skipping down to turn this into a half-volley and flicking into the leg side
there's a speculative appeal as Trott walks across to off and is struck on the left pad ... but it quickly fades. And indeed, that would've gone over the top of leg
Trott is much more solid in defence this time, leaning forward with bat and pad together
Jones is finding consistent movement in to the right-hander off the pitch, this one coming in quite sharply to cramp Trott's flat-footed defence
floated up fuller and wider, Trott drives to cover
nicely full once more, this time Trott aims through mid-on and moves to 49 not out with a single
tip-and-run cricket takes Trott to fifty, as he just dinks the ball close in on the off side and sets off
Morgan angles his bat to get this drive to the left of extra cover, but there's a sweeper out to stop the shot
attempted late dab from Trott, but this one rushes straight on past the outside edge
a sweep, of sorts from Trott. Fetched really, the ball ending up at long-on
Stirling comes round the wicket and spears one down the leg side
he over-corrects with the next delivery, offering up some generous width outside off. Morgan cuts into the deep
flighted down outside off, Trott tapping to mid-on and Stirling sprinting round to cut it off himself
was this the cutter from Jones? It was certainly slower through the air. Morgan nudges to leg, and the bowler leaps athletically across to stop the shot
with Niall O'Brien standing back, Morgan is free to use his feet and does so, swiping out to wide long-on
Trott follows suit, staying back to a length delivery and forcing to long-on
nicely cut towards backward point, but Will Porterfield - Ireland captain and Morgan's childhood friend - is there and dives to his left to pull of an impressive stop
angled away behind square once again, this time he picks the gap
just over a widish mid-off! Trott came aggressively down the track to drive in the air, chipping it over the leaping fielder and getting enough on it to pick up four
Stirling continues, round the wicket, and flights one down full and straight as Morgan defends

what a catch! What a celebration! Stirling tossed another one up and Morgan turned the bat too early as he looked to nudge to leg, the ball taking the leading edge and flying back to the left of Trott. It didn't look as though Stirling would get close to it, but he shuffled quickly to his left and leapt, full stretch, to pluck it out of the air. That wicket meant a lot, and Stirling boots the ball out into the deep in celebration with a big smile
Ravi's off the mark straight away, chopping out towards deep point
Trott set himself to force through cover off the back foot, but the spin back in to him cramped the shot
hacked down to long-on. Uncharacteristically agricultural
driven through cover for an ambled single
on a length, defended to off

gone! What was Bopara trying to do? Jones landed another ball on a good length, this one nibbling away off the wicket, and Bopara just stood at the crease and thrust his bat out at it, the thin edge pouched safely by O'Brien. There's an audible sigh from Sahil as Ravi departs for another low score, another chance gone begging
Stokes negotiates his first ball in international cricket with a solid-looking defence
and he's off the mark now, easing a cautious drive through the gap at cover
Trott chopped down a little too hard on the cut here, hitting the ball straight down
that's better, again width is offered and this time the cut is nailed in front of the point fielder for a single
very full, right up to the bat, and Trott taps back to the bowler
a very excitable Niall O'Brien launches into an appeal as Trott is struck on the pad, but there was a big inside edge on that
driven back to the bowler, who dives to his left to field
sliced down towards third man, there's a slight fumble and they're back for the second
Trott stays back to punch through cover off the back foot, just the single this time
arrowed down much quicker and flatter from round the stumps, Stokes coming forward in defence
not quite close enough to him for the drive, but plenty of width to work with and Trott gets the ball away through cover
Stokes walks down into a high-elbowed drive, but mid-off has been brought up and it's straight to him
again Stokes walks into the stroke, this time angling the bat to look for a single to gully. There's none to be had
good pressure being built up by Jones, yet again he's on a full length, tight on off stump, and Stokes' drive goes to extra cover
superb one-day bowling, especially in these conditions. Jones gives Stokes no width to work with, and a defensive push goes to extra cover

leading edge! Jones was wrong-footed in his follow through and couldn't even dive across at the ball as it flew past him and down to long-off. Not really a missed chance though, he'd have struggled to get close. Still, good bowling.
Stirling comes round the wicket to Stokes, who stretches forward to drive to cover, finding the gap
Trott stays right back in his crease and works with the spin for a single

there's another one! Stokes had been under pressure from the start of his innings. He drove hard, and perhaps a little too early, at this one to send the ball straight back to the bowler, who made no mistake. Stirling has his second.
Patel gets back to defend to midwicket
punched back to the bowler, not much flight on this one
pulled down much too short by Stirling, but Patel has only just arrived and is content just to flick him to leg for a single
Patel didn't look too comfortable as this one seamed sharply back in to him, the inside edge bobbling off the pad to allow a single
angled down towards gully
tapped down the ground
Patel stays back to defend to cover
Patel's first really aggressive stroke. He skips down the track and slaps a drive out to deep extra cover
again Patel comes down the track, this time Jone adjusts his length and the batsman can only nudge to point
very full outside off, squeezed out in front of point for one. A slightly wild return flies over O'Brien, but there's someone backing up
dabbed late, but straight to short third man

shot! And almost great fielding from Mooney running round from long-off. Patel chipped the drive to wide long-off and it looked to have beaten Mooney, but he dived over and managed to parry it safely back, only for the ball to keep rolling and touch the rope. Good effort
four more, but not quite as Patel had intended. He was looking to heave over the off side again, but the ball found the edge and flew past short third man
driven down the ground
slapped away through cover for one more
on the pads, Trott glances to leg but picks out a fielder
full on off stump, Trott feels his way into the powerplay with a checked drive to cover
the offcutter lands on an awkward length, and Trott picks up a single with an ungainly swipe to long-on
Patel perishes in the pursuit of quick runs! He tried to go over long-off but could only get as far as Kevin O'Brien, and England have been pegged back by another timely wicket.
Woakes is off the mark straight away, tapping the ball wide of the man at midwicket
again Trott picks out the fielder. This time it was the man at point. Trott has played some good shots but, generally, he's struggled for fluency in these conditions.
bravely flighted by Stirling, Woakes stepping to it and driving back to the bowler
Woakes uses his feet this time, turning the bat face slightly to get the ball down to long-on

well, Trott is really trying to force the pace here but it just doesn't come naturally to him. He set himself well outside leg as Stirling bowled and aimed a huge heave to midwicket, but picked out the man on the boundary to perfection
clipped to leg, just the one
Trott gets the left leg out of the way and has a mow, but it's only one down to long on
Woakes jumps out to turn this into a low full toss, glancing to midwicket
nudged down the ground for one

the first forcing shot Trott has timed in ages, and it's landed right in the lap of the only man out on the midwicket boundary! The ball was full, the shot was on, and Trott found the middle of the bat - but the fielder didn't have to move. Another wicket, and Ireland will be loving this.
chopped down close and in front of point, a quick single taken
Borthwick goes back and across to defend his first ball in international cricket
fuller, and zoning in on off stump. Borthwick taps watchfully to cover

Borthwick isn't going to waste any time here! Mooney sent down an offcutter, but it was much too short and the left-hander rocked back to pull the ball high and out to long leg. It bounced just inside the rope
shot! Controlled aggression from Woakes. He targeted the boundary but didn't lose his shape, and didn't hack across the line, the ball sailing straight back over Stirling's head
squirted out behind square, and they sprint back for the second
Woakes charges out to take the ball on the full toss, driving very hard through cover
nice shot from Borthwick, who also uses his feet as Stirling speared down a quicker ball, the single coming to long off
flicked to leg, Woakes' back leg in the air. The ball goes to midwicket but they commit to a single ... the throw is good, but Woakes is safely in
shovelled in the air out to deep midwicket, the ball dropping well short of the fielder

great effort by Mooney! He looped down a slow offcutter, Borthwick slicing across it and the ball ballooning up and hanging in the air ... Mooney sprinted back, and even dived, but he couldn't quite get to it. And there's almost a run-out as he flicks the ball back at the stumps!

Mooney is really throwing himself around to save every run here, great effort again. Woakes swung wildly but the ball came off the toe end, Mooney flinging himself to his left to stop it in his follow through and then back-flicking towards the non-striker's stumps
dropped at short fine leg! Borthwick was attempting the paddle to fine leg, got some bat on it, and the fielder couldn't quite hold onto it. Mooney looks very upset
well, he'll be just about ready to bottle someone now. Straight after the drop, Borthwick steps down and slams him down the ground for a crisp six
there's another one! Borthwick perishes in the cause, looking to go over the midwicket boundary but getting only as far as Stirling's save pair of hands
good finish from Woakes, cracking the ball back over Mooney's head, a couple of bounces and he finishes things with a four

inn2.comm: sweetly driven by Ed Joyce. Full of style and grace, but straight to cover
patted gently back down the pitch
Ireland are away, with a boundary too. Wide from Woakes and Joyce sliced it airily but wide of a diving James Taylor at point
this is straighter from Woakes and Joyce defends
swing, and plenty of it. Too much of it, in fact, down the leg side
left alone outside off. Woakes just straining to find a good line
back of a length around off stump and stroked to cover
starts with a wide slipped down the leg side
bang! Enough width for Stirling to throw his arms at and Stirling is a sweet striker of the ball. This pings off the bat and flies flat for six over cover!
struck firmly with the straightest of blades but straight to Finn
oh dear. What a waste. Having played a couple of nice strokes Stirling slogs across the line and gets an edge that loops to Bopara at cover
good delivery from Finn, back of a length, touch of extra bounce and very straight
clipped off the hip to square leg
excellent one-handed take from Kieswetter down the leg side as Finn misdirects onto the pad
Woakes finds a tidy line outside off stump and Joyce plays inside the line
left alone with bat above head this time
good delivery zips back a touch from a full length. Something about his action suggests he won't ever be express
Joyce plays across the line and a leading edge skews wide of the slips and away for four
defended back down the pitch
left alone outside off stump
Finn ventures full and Porterfield drives and misses outside off. Finn gives him a knowing stare. Not sure why
very full from Finn, full toss in fact
that's better. Hits a full length and zips it away past Porterfield's outside edge
good line from Finn, good length too. Porterfield blocks
left alone outside off stump this time. Porterfield content to bide his time. Unlike Stirling. Bah, I was really looking forward to watching Stirling bat
driven to mid-on to complete a maiden over
England stringing dots together as Woakes finds an off-stump line
prodded out to cover. Morgan is wearing sun shades, not sure what he's seeing but it looks gloomy to me. Maybe he's trying to be cool, in an 80s sort of way
defence from Joyce. Solid defence
good delivery, nipped away off a well-presented seam. Joyce pokes at nothing
Joyce skews this off an inside edge. Lack of pace in the pitch you see
second maiden. Good one too. Something has to give, no?
good delivery from the zippy Finn. Full, nipped away past the outside edge
excellent bowling from Finn. 16 dot balls in a row
dot dot dot etc. Excellent bowling
finally the shackles are broken, and Porterfield opens his account. Leg-side nurdle for a couple. Just like Trott would do
after all that excitement Porterfield reverts to blocking

dropped! Porterfield gets away with one. Full and pushed across the left-hander, Porterfield drove firmly and a thick edge went wide to Samit Patel at second slip, he dived well enough but spilled the take
misfield now at point, James Taylor is the culprit, but he looks so eager when he catches up with it you can't be too harsh
defended back to the bowler
appeal from the bowler as he finds the pads but it pitched outside leg
short ball shoved down and Porterfield pulls his Warwickshire seamer down to fine leg where Finn slides well, and straight past the ball
defence follows boundary. Always seems better when it does
inside edge reaches midwicket to end the over
Finn gets his reward! Second wicket for him as he holds this on off stump again and Joyce outside edges to the keeper. With every wicket Trott's innings looks more valuable
starts by leaving alone very efficiently outside his off stump
turns a fuller ball through midwicket to get himself off the mark
this again zips away off the deck. Finn looks a level above the other bowlers on show today
extra bounce from a length and Niall O'Brien pops up on his toes to block
good carry outside off stump to end a good over
Woakes is full and driven hard to mid-off
bit of seam movement again for Woakes, finds an inside edge
clipped off the pads for a single
good line from Woakes around off stump. Defended to cover
Woakes overpitches a touch but the firm drive finds his boot
lovely shot for one, that. Stood up and banged it towards cover where Morgan slid round to field
again Niall O'Brien's good timing is not rewarded well enough. Finn stuck out a mit to stop this straight drive
good delivery around off stump. Defended to cover
Finn, who Cricinfo UK desk, have decided would walk into any other Test team, beats an outside edge
driven without perfect timing which allows mid-off to hurry round to field
top shot! Having lined Finn up Niall O'Brien dares some adventure and plonks him over midwicket
driven solidly to mid-on to end the over
hitting the seam, bursting past the outside edge of a poking bat. Woakes doesn't quite look Test class yet, but he's a useful one-day bowler
great riposte from Porterfield! Where the last shot was lacking in intent, this one was brimming with it, the Ireland captain pushing his weight back and slamming a pull through square leg
punched firmly to mid-off off the back foot
once again Porterfield stands upright at the crease and tries to force the ball through cover, this time it takes the inside edge
Woakes strays down leg, but Porterfield can't put bat on ball and is rapped on the pad
well, this wicket is certainly still doing a bit sideways. Woakes has seamed another past the outside edge of Porterfield's bat
just short of a good length to start, O'Brien hopping back and across to defend under the eyes
tip-and-run, well run by the batsmen! O'Brien dropped the ball softly towards mid-off, and there was just enough time for a sprinted single
Dernbach steams in and slams one down, again just short of a good length. Porterfield is right behind it in defence
that's better from Dernbach, a touch fuller and Porterfield is caught on the crease as he looks to drive
Porterfield is half forward in defence, angling his bat to send the ball towards point
nice and full to finish, Porterfield driving to mid-off
driven just wide of mid-off for a quick single
beaten outside off! Bopara offered some width but Porterfield cut over the top of it, the ball skidding through low
whipped off the pad, but he hits midwicket
shot! The cover drive is part shovel, part rapier. All class.
good comeback from Bopara, Porterfield defends
and more defence to end the over
begins with flight! Brazen. Clipped to midwicket

happy to throw it up once more, it's worked to leg but Porterfield wanted a single that wasn't quite there and took an age to turn back. Very gently he ended up being run out as Borthwick scampered round and flicked back to Kieswetter before the Ireland captain could return
who starts with a leave. Borthwick throws it up again, high arm action so gets some dip
driven firmly to cover
couple of sighters and then... bosh! Kevin thuds down the wicket and swings his enormous arms through the line
hehe. Love it. Big foot thrust down the wicket and sweep shot smashed miles and miles away. Still, think that'd a good first international over from Borthwick. Quick spinner, mind
Niall is plenty different to his brother - good hands, quick feet, nurdles a single to midwicket
the crowd love everything Kevin O'Brien does, even clunking a single to deep point
Niall again skips across to the off side to work to leg. Quality batting
ah that's brilliant. Best shot of the three. Backs away to the leg side to open up extra cover and creams it to the rope
"catch, catch, catch" dreams Patel as the toe-ended drive heads towards long-off on the bounce
very compact forward defence
starts with his stock-ball slower ball which Kevin O'Brien works round the corner. Delicately, almost
the infielders are hanging on the edge of the circle so Niall O'Brien can push to cover and collect an easy single
Kevin O'Brien was eyeing something huge there but expected pace from Dernbach. It was a slower ball though and he was through the shot much too early
this is a good over of slowerballs - this one out the back of the hand. Niall prods and misses outside off
gone! Niall O'Brien picks out Finn at deep square. Slower bouncer and Niall O'Brien couldn't keep his pull shot down
slipped down the leg side but flicked a pad on the way through. Makes that an excellent over
worked down the ground to get Jones off the mark
O'Brien circumspect here as he works the ball to the leg side
slower ball from Bopara. Good length and line too. Bunted down the ground
this time the slower ball is misdirected and it dribbles down leg
clipped neatly into the leg side. Not expansive but efficient

smart fielding off his own bowling from Bopara as Jones slapped it back at him. With the batsman wandering out of his crease Bopara flung the ball back and it hit Jones. Bopara stares, as does Jones. Like a particularly odd Western
gone! Bopara gets his man! Back of the hand slower ball and Jones was through the shot a good hour early. Had time to watch it clip the top of his middle stump
O'Brien sees this slower one from Dernbach and carefully paddles it round the corner for four
another slow one. Not slower because there are no quick ones. O'Brien waited and checked his drive. Ended up drilling to long-off on the bounce
smart from Wilson, that's how to partner Kevin O'Brien - get him on strike. Just nibbles the ball to leg and scampers
that's probably the match! Brilliant bowling! After all those slower ones Dernbach has rocked in a yorker at almost 90mph. O'Brien can't get his bat down in time!
haha, Mooney was deceived by this slower ball but went with his kind of flick shot anyway and timed it perfectly. Few to the straight midwicket rope
this is much quicker and too quick for Mooney outside off stump
Bopara is useful with his skiddy medium pace. Beats Wilson outside off
this is slapped hard back at the bowler who sticks a speculative hand out
Mooney steers this straight to short third man but still manages a single
Wilson swings his bat across the ball without much timing. Plenty of effort for a single down the ground
Bopara tucks Mooney up from round the wicket and it's clipped to leg to one
bunted down the ground. Singles will do England nicely
full and quick and straight. Wilson backs away and slaps to deep point
new ball please! Mooney spots the slower ball, steadies himself and plonks this over the stands at midwicket
this was quicker - yorker too. Mooney did well to dig it out then set off for a single that would have been out if Morgan's throw had hit
another quick ball is worked to midwicket
powerfully driven straight down the ground. Mooney is a dangerous player. Looks it too. Well fielded on the boundary
ah Mooney almost got enough here. Smashed it down the ground and Stokes did well on the boundary edge to hold on above his head
good delivery around off stump worked to point
top shot! Third man comes into the ring and Wilson squeezed it past him for four
slower ball is dabbed to point for a single
big swing at fresh air as Cusack fails to spot a slower ball
"no!" screams Bopara as he bowls. Rightly so - it was shoved down the leg side
slower ball is flipped to deep square where Finn runs in sharply to prevent two
slower ball ends a decent over. Worked carefully to short third man. England are favourites but one big over will change that swiftly
good start from Patel - full and straight - bunted back to the bowler
flash and a miss outside off this time! Excellent work from the bowler
Wilson skips down and slugs across the line but is through the shot too early and it hits his pad
grim mis-hit toe-ended down the ground. Top work from Patel
smart bowling with a touch of air and spin gets Patel reward. Wilson had to try and find the boundary but ended up with an outside edge that looped towards Bopara who clung on
touch of spin unnerves Cusack as he comes down the  ground. Ends up skewing a drive out to Finn at deep point
clubbed with plenty of inelegance down the ground but only for one
Cusack manages a single in the end. He horribly mistimed this back to the bowler but with Dockrell haring up the other end Dernbach aimed a shy - and missed - the overthrow collected the single
very quick from Dernbach. Too quick for Dockrell
shot! The little man goes big! Full toss thrashed down the ground for four
Dockrell ran down the wicket and outside leg. Dernbach was full and outside off so the batsman had to leave it
and that's that. Play and a miss to end the game which means England win a scrappy match quite comfortably
